farm somebody/something ↔ out.translatio: to send work to other people instead of doing it yourself
The processing will be farmed out to people in local villages.
to send someone to a different place where they will be looked after – used to show disapproval
At the age of 16 she was farmed out to family friends.
to send work to other people, especially people outside your company, instead of doing it yourself
Some of the work can be farmed out to freelancers.
